text:
I got motivated for becoming a teacher by many people and cultural products. First of all, i have had the chance, in my scholarity to have good teachers who cared about their students and wanted  all of them to get the life that they wanted. For example, my fisrt biology teacher, who I will remember my whole life was obsessed by nature and it's diversity and wanted so much to get us obsessed the same way. My Math teacher helped me and listened when I was down. I haven't always wanted to become a teacher but this idea regularly went back in my head. My parents also have a lot of firends who are teachers and they often talk about their jobs and how teenagers are in need of good teachers.
I've also read and seen so much  fictions about this job. Like GTO for example. It's a Japanese anime about a thug becoming a teacher in a class of teenagers with social, economical and  scholar issues. He achieves to really understand them and help them in their personal lives as well as in their scholar lives. They have so much fun with him and they get better. There's also that book from Alex Dupont "chagrin d'école" in which he explains how some of his teachers saved him from scholar failing and self-hate when he was young.
I've also worked in a summer camp. Living with children is giving me energy and motivation. To my eye, they're the only magic that exists on earth. Their imagination and their ability to tell themselves fabulous stories at every moment of their lives.
